release.action: Handlers now support XML "flow", which adds supports for if/ifNot/condition/then/else tags in XML configuration.
New "condition" classes for XML "flow" configuration: BlankCondition, DateCondition, DOMCondition, NumericCondition, ReferenceCondition, ScriptCondition, and TextCondition.
New RejectFilter.
New CharsetUtil#firstNonBlankOrUTF8(...) methods.
When not already set, an attempt to detect document character encoding is now always made before invoking handlers.
New CommonMatchers class.
New ImageTransformer class.
New NoContentTransformer class.
New -f or "outputMetaFormat" command-line argument for saving exported metadata fields in alternate formats.
New TextFilter class.
New ReferenceFilter class.
New ExternalHandler class.
New DOMFilter class.
New EmptyFilter class.
New RegexTagger class.
New URLExtractorTagger class.
New DOMDeleteTransformer class.
New XMLStreamSplitter class.
New HandlerDoc to ease handler implementations.
Importer now uses an EventManager and triggers several events: IMPORTER_HANDLER_BEGIN, IMPORTER_HANDLER_END, IMPORTER_HANDLER_ERROR, IMPORTER_PARSER_BEGIN, IMPORTER_PARSER_END, IMPORTER_PARSER_ERROR
New ImporterDocument#getStreamFactory() method.
ReplaceTagger now has the option to discard values that are unchanged after replacement.
New options on CharacterCaseTagger: "wordsFully", "stringFully", "sentences", and "sentencesFully".
Most configurable classes adding/setting metadata values now have an extra "onSet" option for dictating how values are set: append, prepend, replace, optional.
New DocInfo class.
New ImporterRequest class.
New option in DOMTagger to delete elements matched by a selector.
Added time zone support to DateMetadataFilter.
Added support for Webp image format.
Now requires Java 8 or higher.
Importer#importDocument(...) now expects an ImporterRequest or a Doc.
Default allocated memory for caching of document content was increased by a factor of 10 (100MB max per document, 1GB max total).
XML configuration of handlers had their XML tag names changed from "filter", "tagger", "transformer, "splitter" to simply "handler".
JBIG2 image support now included under apache license.
Logging now using SLF4J.
Maven dependency updates: Norconex Commons Lang 2.0.0, Apache Tika 1.22, Apache Commons CLI 1.4, Junit 5.
RegexFieldExtractor and RegexUtil have been deprecated in favor of Norconex Commons Lang FieldValueExtractor and Regex.
RegexContentFilter and RegexMetadataFilter have been deprecated in favor of TextFilter.
RegexReferenceFilter has been deprecated in favor of ReferenceFilter.
DOMContentFilter has been deprecated in favor of DOMFilter.
EmptyMetadataFilter has been deprecated in favor of EmptyFilter.
TextPatternTagger has been deprecated in favor of RegexTagger.
TextBetweenTagger now has "inclusive" and "caseSensitive" options configurable for each "between" details.
Now using Path instead of File in many cases.
Parsing no longer attempted on zero-length content.
List of PropertyMatcher replaced with PropertyMatchers.
ContentTypeDetector methods are now static.
Eliminated Apache Tika log warnings on startup when missing specific optional libraries not package due to licensing (e.g. JPEG 2000, jbig2).
Occurrences of accessors for overwrite="[false|true]" and onConflict="..." have been deprecated in favor of new onSet="...".
Most places where regular expressions could be used now also support "basic" matching and "wildcard" as well as being able to ignore diacritical marks (e.g., accents).
Most occurrences of "caseSensitive" or "caseInsensitive" configuration options are now replaced with "ignoreCase".
Filters implementing AbstractStringFilter will now have their isStringContentMatching(...) method invoked at least once, even if there is no document content.
"parsed" boolean arguments were replaced by ParseState.PRE and ParseState.POST.
Many methods with a combinations of reference, input stream, and metadata were updated to now accept a Doc instance instead.
Removed some of the methods deprecated in previous releases.
Removed SplittableDocument.
